daunt:
使胆怯；使气馁；使失去信心 
to make somebody feel nervous and less confident about doing something
convert:
转换 
to change (something) into a different form or so that it can be used in a different way
rudimentary:
初步的，未发展的 
not very developed or advanced
stigmatize:
污名化，使感到羞耻；侮蔑 
to treat somebody in a way that makes them feel that they are very bad or unimportant
impulsive:
人或行为 凭冲动行事的；易冲动的 
(of people or their behaviour) acting suddenly without thinking carefully about what might 
happen because of what you are doing
plaintiff:
原告 
a person who sues another person or accuses another person of a crime in a court of law
atone:
赎 罪 ；弥补过错 
to act in a way that shows you are sorry for doing something wrong in the past
intonation:
语调，说话的抑扬顿挫 
the sound changes produced by the rise and fall of the voice when speaking, especially 
when this has an effect on the meaning of what is said
melancholy:
忧郁 
a sad mood or feeling

令人悲伤的 
feeling or showing sadness; very unhappy
diplomatic:
有手腕的，有策略的 
involving the work of maintaining good relations between the governments of different countries
cramped:
拥挤的 
not having enough space inside; too small and crowded 
210
dodge:
闪开；躲开；避开 
to move quickly and suddenly to one side in order to avoid somebody/something

尤指不诚实地逃避 
to avoid doing something, especially in a dishonest way

推脱的计策；逃避的诡计；骗人的伎俩 
a clever and dishonest trick, played in order to avoid something
proclaim:
声明 
to say or state (something) in a public, official, or definite way;to declare or announce (something)
propagate:
宣传；传播；使普及 
to make (something, such as an idea or belief) known to many people
appalling:
令人震惊的 
very bad in a way that causes fear, shock, or disgust
mingle:
混合 
to combine or bring together two or more things

应酬；交际 
to move around during a party, meeting, etc., and talk informally with different people
idyllic:
闲适恬静的 
very peaceful, happy, and enjoyable
mansion:
大厦，宅邸 
a large and impressive house; the large house of a wealthy person
protocol:
议定书；协议 
a document that describes the details of a treaty or formal agreement between countries

礼仪，外交礼仪 
a system of rules that explain the correct conduct and procedures to be followed in formal situations

治疗方案；科学实验计划 
a plan for a course of medical treatment; a plan for a scientific experiment.
divisive:
造成不和的，引起纷争的 
used to describe something that causes great and sometimes unfriendly disagreement within 
a group of people
malign:
恶意的 
causing or intending to cause harm or evil
obligate:
迫使 
to make (a person or organization) do something because the law requires it or because it is 
the right thing to do 
211
generic:
通用的，一般的 
of or relating to a whole group or class
cyclical:
周期的 
happening again and again in the same order; happening in cycles
gaze:
凝视；注视；盯着 
to look steadily at somebody/something for a long time, either because you are very 
interested or surprised, or because you are thinking of something else

凝视；注视 
a long steady look at somebody/something
fecund:
多产的，肥沃的 
producing or able to produce many babies, young animals, or plants
florid:
人脸 红润的 
(of a person's face) red

过分装饰的；过多修饰的 
having too much decoration or detail
flagrant:
罪恶昭彰的；明目张胆的；公然的 
very bad; too bad to be ignored
jolly:
愉快的，快乐的；令人快乐的；惬意的 
happy and cheerful; enjoyable
esoteric:
难懂的，深奥的，常人难以理解的 
only taught to or understood by members of a special group
relegate:
贬黜；把…降级；把…降格 
to put (someone or something) in a lower or less important position, rank, etc.
foresight:
先见之明 
the ability to see what will or might happen in the future 
212
wig:
假发，法官帽 
a piece of artificial hair that is worn on the head, for example to hide the fact that a person 
is bald, to cover somebody's own hair, or by a judge and some other lawyers in some 
courts of law
dawdle:
拖延；磨蹭；游荡 
to take a long time to do something or go somewhere
downright:
强调令人不快或负面的事或行为彻头彻尾地，十足地，完全地 
(of something bad or unpleasant) utter; complete (used for emphasis)
caloric:
热量的 
of or relating to heat
ramp:
斜坡 
a usually sloping road that connects a road to a highway
coerce:
胁迫 
to make (someone) do something by using force or threats
antiquated:
陈旧的，过时的 
very old and no longer useful, popular, or accepted; very old-fashioned or obsolete
deference:
顺从 
a way of behaving that shows respect for someone or something
nomad:
游牧民 
a member of a group of people who move from place to place instead of living in one place 
all the time
transgress:
越轨；违背 道德；违犯法律 
to go beyond the limit of what is morally or legally acceptable
felicity:
恰当，妥帖，得体 
something that is pleasing and well chosen
missionary:
传教士 
a person who is sent to a foreign country to do religious work
traumatic:
外伤的 造成精神创伤的 
psychologically or emotionally stressful in a way that can lead to serious mental and emotional problems 
213
incumbent:
现任的；在职者 
person who currently holds an office or position
disenthrall:
释放 
to free from bondage; liberate
pun:
双关语 
a humorous way of using a word or phrase so that more than one meaning is suggested

说双关语 
to make a pun
chamber:
私人房间，会所 
a room where a judge goes to do official business or to discuss cases with lawyers outside 
of the courtroom

会客厅 
a usually large room where members of a government group (such as a legislature) have meetings
abridge:
缩短 
to shorten (a book, a play, etc.) by leaving out some parts
rave:
咆哮 
to talk or write about someone or something in an excited or enthusiastic way
stance:
立场 
a publicly stated opinion

站姿 
a way of standing
thrifty:
节约的 
managing or using money in a careful or wise way
sedate:
沉静的，庄重的 
quiet and peaceful; calm; slow and relaxed

给…施用镇静剂 
to give (a person or animal) drugs that cause relaxation or sleep
thematic:
主题的；专题的 
of or relating to a theme
pedal:
自行车等的脚蹬子，踏板 
a flat bar on a machine such as a bicycle, car, etc. that you push down with your foot in 
order to make parts of the machine move or work

骑自行车 
to ride a bicycle somewhere 
214
curb:
控制 
to control or limit (something)

路肩，马路牙子 
a short border along the edge of a street that is usually made of stone or concrete
smug:
沾沾自喜的，自鸣得意的 
having or showing an excessive pride in oneself or one's achievements
retain:
保持 
to continue to have or use (something)

记住 
to keep (something) in your memory especially for a long period of time
rejoice:
高兴 
to feel or show that you are very happy about something
divest:
剥夺 
to take (something) away from (someone or something else)
nibble:
啃；一点一点地咬或吃 
to eat slowly or with small bites
vindicate:
证明…无辜 证明…正确； 
to prove that what someone said or did was right or true, after other people thought it was wrong
defendant:
被告 
a person who is being sued or accused of a crime in a court of law
benignant:
仁慈的，有益的，和蔼的 
pleasant and beneficial in nature or influence; characterized by kindness and warm courtesy 
especially of a king to his subjects
wistful:
渴求的 
having or showing sad thoughts and feelings about something that you want to have or do 
and especially about something that made you happy in the past
noxious:
有害的，有毒的 
harmful to living things; toxic
defy:
公然反抗 
to refuse to obey (something or someone)

使…难于；使不能 
to make (something) very difficult or impossible
tumble:
摔倒； 
to fall down suddenly and quickly

价格或数量暴跌 
to fall or drop suddenly in amount, value, etc.
cerebral:
大脑的 
of or relating to the brain

清醒的，理智的 
related to the mind rather than to feelings; intellectual and not emotional
prospect:
可能性，前景 
the possibility that something will happen in the future

勘探 
to search an area for gold, minerals, oil, etc.
recite:
尤指对听众背诵，吟诵；朗诵 
to say aloud a poem, piece of literature, etc. that you have learned, especially to an audience

口头 列举；逐一讲述 
to say aloud a list or series of things
inapt:
不适当的 
not appropriate or suitable; not apt
retard:
使变缓，阻止 
to slow down the development or progress of (something)
vicinity:
接近，临近 
the area around or near a particular place
dissent:
不同意，异议 
a strong difference of opinion on a particular subject, especially about an official 
suggestion or plan or a popular belief
prerequisite:
先决条件 
something that you officially must have or do before you can have or do something else
detour:
绕道 
to make (someone or something) go in a direction that is not planned or expected
